DEPARTMENT OF
HEALTH, EDUCATION, AND WELFARE
OFFICE OF EDUCATION
WASHINGTON 25, D. C.
January 19, 1960
Dr. Samuel Becker
Associate Professor and Director
Division of Television, Radio, Film
The State University of Iowa
Iowa City, Iowa
Dear Dr. Becker:
True to our promise of last week, we have secured necessary
approvals to put you to work on the job of abstracting Title VII
proposals. It is a real pleasure to have your cooperation in this
matter and we have high hopes for the final products.
Enclosed or being forwarded to you are:
1) approximately fifty copies of the abstracting form which
you will use;
2) four sample abstracts which we prepared (and one proposal
Â£#409.17 which you can compare with its abstract);
3) two sets of "Directions for.Abstracters" which should
guide you in the work;
4) the thirteen or fourteen proposals which you will abstract;
5) five copies of the contract.
If the contract is agreeable to you, please sign each of the
five copies and return them to us immediately in the enclosed envelope.
After they are signed here by Dr. Hall, a copy will be returned to you
for your file. You will not need to submit a bill to us on completion
of the work. Instead, we will initiate payment procedures when the
completed abstracts are received and we are told that three to four
weeks will be required to put the check in your hands.
Good luck in the work and let us know of any assistance we can
give or any detail which we overlooked.
Sincerely yours
Karren F. Seibert
senior Research Coordinator
Educational Media Branch
Enclosure
